fields.description:
Each member of our small team always gets an email-notification when any of the members pushes into our bitbucket repository.

The title of the email is the commit message and the body of the message contains the human-readable changes file-by-file and line-by-line.

Sometimes we receive a random sequence of characters instead of those changes. Here's a screenshot of one of my recent commits:

!53354299-Selection_011.png|thumbnail!

I'm unable to replicate the issue. I see no pattern in the times it happens.
fields.summary: Email-notification for pushing the changesets contains a random character sequence instead of the changeset details

fields.description:
When I try to push a lot of data to a Mercurial repository then although the push actually succeeds (the commits appear on Bitbucket) Mercurial will show it as failing with "HTTP Error 503: Service Unavailable".

It's not that I'm pushing many commits but rather many file changes (cca. half a million) or the data size is too big (~27MB). I don't know which one causes the issue, or if both are required.
fields.summary: Large push to Mercurial repository causes 503 error

fields.description:
It would be really helpful for us to get the amount of time between the following events:

* Open -> On-Hold
* Open -> Resolved

This will help to all of us to keep track of how much time we spend on an issue.

After those times are calculated you can add another column on https://bitbucket.org/[owner]/[repo]/issues called "Time spent" or something like that, showing the amount of time spent on each issue.
fields.summary: Display elapsed time on issues from open-on-hold and open-resolved

fields.description: Bamboo has a final step which allows unit test to be parsed no matter if there is a failing test.  I believe this would be a useful feature for Pipelines assuming that multiple steps are implemented.
fields.summary: Final Step required for parsing unit tests or other clean up or roll back

fields.description:
My changes some time donot get reflected in the list of Recent Activity. Hence, am unable to push them to my staging server. I have done 3 commits today, but unable to deploy them. Pls help.

I have attached Screenshots for your reference.
fields.summary: Changes made in the repository not visible in the list of Recent Activity.

fields.description: I seem to be added to a group of a repository I don't manage (no idea which one). When I manage groups for my repositories that group constantly appear there in the combo box. I failed to find any means to remove myself from that alien group. Please let me know if there is a way, or support it.
fields.summary: Allow a user to leave a group

fields.description:
I have changed an icon for a project, it seems to get updated in some parts of the platform but not in the Projects menu ("Recently Viewed" section). No cache cleanup in the browser helps. It would appear it is just not being updated for that part at all.

The same thing can be observed in the repository details. There is a combo box there where you can assign a repo to a project, and there the project icon is not getting updated either.

Maybe there are some other places where it's not updated.
fields.summary: Project icon is not getting updated

fields.description:
Links to wiki pages now look like this:\\
https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/wiki/Some%20wiki%20page

So, when someone changes the title, the link dies.  I propose to add some id to it and remain the text part but make it optional, like in issues:\\
https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/wiki/123/Some%20wiki%20page
fields.summary: Title-agnostic links to wiki pages

fields.description: I really appreciate Issue Tracker of Bitbucket. However, I've noticed that Issue Tracker page does not warn when leaving in the middle of editing. In fact, I've lost quite a labor-intensive comments a few times by this. Sometimes, preview and finished comment look the same and I tend to reload the page inadvertently. I am pretty sure that showing "Do you really want to leave the page?" dialog is not an issue for Atlassian, so please implement that feature.
fields.summary: Add refresh/leave page dialogue within issue editing pages to prevent lost data. (user request)
REST API should expose whether a branch is active or not

fields.description: We have been organizing our repos by setting the repository language (C, C++, etc.). However, there is no option for ROS in this list. Can you please add it?
fields.summary: Add ROS as a repo language

fields.description: Each time I review a Pull Request, I have to manually select Ignore Whitespace and wait for PR page to reload. It would be nice to have that selection automatically be remembered for next time. If there are times I don't want to ignore whitespace, I can simply untick it and it too is remembered globally, without having to go to a separate settings area.
fields.summary: User setting to always ignore whitespace

fields.description:
To me, email was sent from Atlassian Bitbucket:

{code}
Hello
We're emailing you because you host a static website using Bitbucket.
You can now access your site using https://src.hhsprings.bitbucket.io –
we've added SSL for your security.
Don't worry: your site is still accessible at http://src.hhsprings.bitbucket.org.
We will begin automatically redirecting traffic from the .org TLD to .io on
January 16th, 2017. After March 1st, 2017,
requests to http://src.hhsprings.bitbucket.org will no longer be supported.
HTTPS is required for all requests to https://src.hhsprings.bitbucket.io.
Please update any links or references to http://src.hhsprings.bitbucket.org
to instead point to https://src.hhsprings.bitbucket.io. If you have any
questions, please refer to
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing+a+Website+on+Bitbucket+Cloud.
Thanks,
The Bitbucket team
{code}

First, src.hhsprings.bitbucket.org is my *PRIVATE* repository for managing contents and sources for  http://hhsprings.bitbucket.org.

Second, access to "https" would be rejected by the browsers, because certificates are self-signed.

(Third, generally, I am not going to host static website on bitbucket If SSL is required.)

[Reffered link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing%2Ba%2BWebsite%2Bon%2BBitbucket%2BCloud] doesn't answer to my question. If we will have to use SSL always, please consider the problem for certificates.
fields.summary: About mail "Bitbucket hosted sites are getting better at bitbucket.io!"

fields.description:
I'm once again confronted with big files accidentally pushed to the repo,\\
which has now gone from 100M -> almost 500M. I know how to do the BFG\\
clean thing but it would be nice if we would have some way to limit the size of files that can be\\
pushed.
fields.summary: Limit size of files pushed to bitbucket

fields.summary: API 2.0 does not recognize master_branch when attempting to set main branch of repository.

fields.description:
When requesting using Bitbucket API, you will get back:
  • project
    • Select a valid choice. That choice is not one of the available choices.
This works normally for individual account owned repositories. Full output: {code} #!python RonCYJ@RonCYJ-HP MINGW64 ~ $ curl -X PUT -u rchiateam1: -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/rchiateam1/test -d '{"main_branch": "master"}' #TeamID and API Key % Total % Received % Xferd Average Speed Time Time Time Current Dload Upload Total Spent Left Speed 100 175 100 150 100 25 69 11 0:00:02 0:00:02 --:--:-- 76
  • project
    • Select a valid choice. That choice is not one of the available choices.
RonCYJ@RonCYJ-HP MINGW64 ~ $ curl -X PUT -u AannSmMbGdcNKZw38r: -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/rchiateam1/test -d '{"main_branch": "master"}' #OAuth % Total % Received % Xferd Average Speed Time Time Time Current Dload Upload Total Spent Left Speed 100 25 0 0 100 25 0 11 0:00:02 0:00:02 --:--:-- 13 RonCYJ@RonCYJ-HP MINGW64 ~ $ curl -X PUT -u ronaldchia: -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/rchiateam1/test -d '{"main_branch": "master"}' # Team Admin with App password % Total % Received % Xferd Average Speed Time Time Time Current Dload Upload Total Spent Left Speed 100 175 100 150 100 25 72 12 0:00:02 0:00:02 --:--:-- 80
  • project
    • Select a valid choice. That choice is not one of the available choices.
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to change Team repository Main Branch with Bitbucket API 1.0.

fields.description:
When deleting a repository, you can add a redirect url if the repository has moved elsewhere.  However, this url will be displayed to all visitors regardless of authentication or access.

It would be nice to add a note below the redirect field for private repos warning users that the redirect will be public.
fields.summary: Add warning to "Delete repository" screen that any redirect will be public

fields.description:
Reported environment details:

bq. Windows 10, Chrome Version 52.0.2743.116 m (64-bit), No errors in the console, Source Tree v 1.9.6.1


bq. Windows 10 - Chrome 53.0.2785.101


bq. WIndows 10 Chrome and Edge
fields.summary: "Clone in SourceTree" button not working in Windows

fields.description: I really miss the functionality of letting the pull requests author know that I finished review and I'm waiting for his updates. The author should receive the notification and I should be marked with some icon as waiting. This status should be removed when new commit appears in the pull request.
fields.summary: Pull requests - add "Waiting for author" functionality

fields.description:
Steps:

# open file: Helloworld.exe
# open file: Helloworld.exe

Expected Results:\\
one copy started, no more.

actual result:\\
start second copy server\\
second copy server in loop: connect and discconect
fields.summary: run second copy server in loop

fields.description:
pre-conditions: 1. Install telnet

Steps:

# open file: Helloworld.exe
# open: cmd
# open: cmd
# open: cmd
# open: cmd
# open: cmd
# enter to all cmd windows: telnet 127.0.0.1 4010
# click Enter in all cmd windows

Expected Results:\\
discconect user out time 20sec

actual result:\\
discconect first user time out  20sec\\
after second user discconect  time out  30sec
fields.summary: after second disconnecting user time out 30sec

fields.description:
pre-conditions:

# Install telnet

Steps:

# open file: Helloworld.exe
# copy any text to buffer. Example: 2w%
# open: cmd
# enter to cmd: telnet 127.0.0.1 4010
# click key: Ctrl+V

Expected Results:\\
msg in cmd: "error" or "nothing and  and close connect"

actual result:\\
msg in cmd: 'Hello, World' and close connect
fields.summary: server send msg when query more 1 byte

fields.description:
Steps:

# open file: Helloworld.exe
# open browser FF
# enter URL: http://127.0.0.1:4010
# refresh page: button update in browser

Expected Results:\\
msg in browser: 'Hello, World'

actual result:\\
client wait connecting.\\
port 4010 status: ESTABLISHED
fields.summary: refresh page  button update in browser. Server disconnect and port 4010 ESTABLISHED

fields.description:
Steps:

# open file: Helloworld.exe
# open browser FF
# enter URL: http://127.0.0.1:4010
# refresh page: click key F5 (2-4 click)

Expected Results:\\
msg in browser: 'Hello, World'

actual result:\\
msg in browser: 'Hello, World', but server don't close port 4010
fields.summary: refresh page  F5 don't close port 4010

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users in the user groups with *None* Team permission has no *Leave team* option on the Team Page

###Steps to Reproduce

# Grant User_A with *None* Team permission
# Login with User_A
# Navigate to Team Page

###Expected Results\\
User with *None* Team Permission:\\
!4179201592-LeaveTeamNone1.png|thumbnail!

User with *Create Repositories* Team Permission:\\
!1765622228-LeaveTeamCreateRepositories1.png|thumbnail!

###Workaround\\
Request Team Administrator to remove the user by navigating to *Manage Team>Plan Details*
fields.summary: Users with "None" Team permission has no "Leave Team" option

fields.description:
I am on Windows 7 using Git 2.9.3.windows.1.

I am new to Bitbucket and new to Git.

I forked an existing repository that I need to work on and clicked the clone link to get the Git command and URL to clone the repository to my machine.

I was able to do this successfully on a Mac mini in my office, but when I try to duplicate this on my laptop PC I get the following error:

fatal: unable to access 'https://MY_USERNAME@bitbucket.org/MY_USERNAME/REPOSITORY_NAME.git/': error:140770FC:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:unknown protocol

I found a "resolved" thread on this site (which really wasn't resolved, it had been marked resolved due to no activity), but that didn't help.

Google searches yielded a lot of specific configuration options for other systems and development tools, none of which seemed to address my issue (at least as far as I can tell).

How do I get this to work on my PC?
fields.summary: error:140770FC:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:unknown protocol

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users are required to go to the *Team* page in order to get a list of all projects.\\
The *Project* drop-down navigation only shows “Recent”

h3. Suggested Solution
It will best to have “All of my Projects” link (same for Repositories and Snippets as well, come to think of it) on the *Projects* navigation.\\
These would be pages that have a list of all Projects/Repositories/Snippets you have access to, filterable by Team or Project.
fields.summary: Add link to view all Projects

fields.description:
I'd like to build a dashboard showing a chronological view of all the pipelines across all our repositories, basically a Pipelines activity feed.

I looked through the Bitbucket API docs to see if we could build our own, but I didn't see anything about Pipelines.

I want this feature to provide a high level view of the build activity and to be able to do some forensic analysis of deployment pipelines if something breaks in production. For instance, things went pear shaped at 10 am this morning, show me all the activity on deployment branches between 9 am and 10 am.
fields.summary: Global Pipelines activity log
Bitbucket should support .gitattributes diff

fields.description: It would be really nice if Bitbucket Cloud can support writing markdown when creating tasks inside pull-requests
fields.summary: Customer Request: Support Markdown on PR task
Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.00 KiB/s  when tried to git fetch origin

fields.description:
Customer:

bq. When using a modal interface such as setting branch permissions, the feedback survey continues to appear in the middle of taking action in the modal. Once the survey is closed, the overlay remains but the previous modal is gone and the page has to be refreshed to start over. This occurred 3 times in a row. This is a very poor user experience that should probably be fixed immediately to avoid hurting your feedback ratings.
fields.summary: Feedback survey interrupts modal interface such as setting branch permissions, causing the previous modal to be gone (BBCDEV-2892)

fields.description:
On the issue tracker for a repository, sorting by clicking the "Title" column header actually sorts by issue number (because the issue number is prefixed to the title in the table). I would expect it to sort alphabetically by the title.

Perhaps the issue number and title should be separate columns?
fields.summary: Issue Tracker Sorting by Title

fields.description:
When a user tries accessing \ Pipelines page on a repo, they will shown the error '*You need to be an administrator of this repository to set up Pipelines.*' although the user has admin access to the repository.

This issue seems to only occur on Internet Explorer 11.

!2296798056-upload.png|thumbnail!

Workaround: Use a different browser to access Pipelines
fields.summary: On IE11, accessing the Pipelines page on a repo will come up with the error 'You need to be an administrator of this repository to set up Pipelines.' although the user has admin access to the repo

fields.description:
I noticed you guys do not support a popular scripting language for the vfx industry called *Maxscript*, extension *.ms*. Its the language used for scripting in Autodesk's 3ds Max program. It's been supported on github for several years now and I've recently made the swtich to bitbucket for it's better quality of products.

Sublime text editor supports the syntax highlighting for this language.

We use maxscript as a main tool writing language and it would be nice if we could have properly syntax highlighting.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Maxscript Syntax Highlighting

fields.description:
When  updating a team name (which had been set correctly on creation), on edit, it shows the full name in the edit field, however on reload only the first word remains and the access log shows me updating to the new name, if I and then make further changes after visiting the settings page again, the audit log shows I removed the "last name".

!https://monosnap.com/file/1RZQKOrO9cQZoj2NFHS0gkD8dXYewR.png!
fields.summary: Renaming team causes it to lose the "last name"

fields.description: This is something I've noticed several times and I wish would exist. At the moment BitBucket's PRs show the exact same display regardless of the existence of a newline at the end of a file.
fields.summary: Indicate whether there is a new line at the end of a file in a diff

fields.description:
I realize that JIRA integration is still MIA, but I wanted to voice my desire for the following two things:

1.) Ability to trigger a Pipelines build from JIRA Build and Release.\\
2.) Ability to access the version information, possibly as a Pipelines environment variable within bitbucket-pipelines.yml.  With Bamboo, I am able to access this information using ${bamboo.jira.version}, so I'd be looking for something similar in Pipelines.

(I am mentioning both issues at once, because in Bamboo, ${bamboo.jira.version} is only available when I build from a JIRA release.)
fields.summary: Pipelines Access to JIRA Version

fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to delete builds from the build history.

An example of when this may be useful and appropriate is when build pipelines for a repository are first getting configured. Often the first couple of attempted builds fail due to pipeline configuration errors as items such as environment variables, permissions, etc. are being addressed. It would be useful to delete these builds that show as failures
fields.summary: Allow builds to be deleted from history

fields.description:
Precondition

Step to reproduce

Actual result

Expected result

Workaround
fields.summary: Issue with error message after submit a ticket

fields.description:
Precondition

Step to reproduce

Actual result

Expected result

Workaround
fields.summary: Service giving error response after click on billing button

fields.description:
we have been using the APIs for comment on issue, push and pull request. the content parameter is set as application\json payload, which used to work fine for all three, but from yesterday we are seeing that this is not setting the comment text for issues. On sending the content as url encoded form parameter i was able to resolve the issue.

Was there a change to move to url encoded param? I dont see anything specific in the documentation..
fields.summary: Add new comment on issue not setting comment text

fields.description: Currently, if your build job runs out of memory on pipelines, there is no error messaging that states this was the issue.  We should add error message handling for these instances.
fields.summary: Add better error messag handling when a pipeline runs out of memory.

fields.description:
Hi There,

I'm receiving this error when trying to pull or clone a repo at bitBucket.org

hg clone https://georgezheng@bitbucket.org/utilivisor/utilivisor-datacollection .

or

hg pull

Thanks,\\
George
fields.summary: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error
Trying to commit file edits from the Bitbucket UI will come up with the error 'We had trouble committing your changes. ' (BBCDEV-2731)

fields.description:
We've used bitbucket at our shop for a year now, with great success and cool performance. About a week ago however, the speeds became simply abysmal!

Here's a pull on an up to date branch:

{code}
#!bash
time git pull
Current branch XXX is up to date.

real   	1m17.976s
user   	0m0.178s
sys    	0m0.478s
{code}

That "speed" is our new normal... 😧

Our shop is an ISP, and there's nothing wrong with our connection or indeed our connection to your servers. Also, we're sitting on a gigabit line, located in Copenhagen, Denmark. I'm guessing there's some foobar on your internal network.

Hope you'll look into it, so we can continue to be your happy customers.
fields.summary: Connection speed (internal network issue?)

fields.description: Allow to trigger a build for a branch with a button (without having to push some commits)
fields.summary: Add a "Build Now" button

This appears to be broken for users who sign up through Atlassian Account.

fields.description:

!3424500777-SourceTreeClone.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Request: Include SSH option after clicking "Clone in SourceTree" in Overview Page

fields.description:
I'm aware that it's possible to change the default landing page for a repo, but as far as I can tell, this must be done each time a new repo is created.

Is it possible for a user to have a setting "Default landing page", so that all repos they create have this value as their "Landing page" setting, so that I don't have to change the setting every time I create a new repo?
fields.summary: Default repository landing page for all repos owned by a user

fields.description:
Hello.

I asked here: [Custom diff view|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/41461662/is-it-possible-to-provide-custom-diff-views-for-specific-file-types] if it was possible with atlassian connect, in bitbucket cloud, to create an add-on to provide custom diff views for specific files. The gentleman who answered suggested that I create a feature request, so that's what I'm doing.

Essentially what I want, is an extension point on the pull request overview (diff view) page for each file which has been changed, where I can optionally override the diff view which bitbucket provides (based on the file extension), and provide my own. This is because I have several binary files in source control which I can represent as text, and I would like the team to be able to see what has changed in these files when reviewing pull requests.

Thanks very much!

Jamey.
fields.summary: Add an extension point for the pull request diff view.

fields.description:
h3. Based on customer responses:
When we are reviewing a PullRequest, the most of times, PR have several files involved. In this cases, is pretty "slow" to make the review because some changes are related with other files involved, and to make a good review, we need to check if this changes are correct and consistent with those related files.

This is because we need to scroll up to find the files list, look up the related file, and check changes. This kind of actions could be easiest and faster if the list of the files involved in the PR, will be fixed at the left of the screen. In that way, will be fast to find the files that we need to check and later come back to the lines we were reviewing  previously.

To make a summary, i think that will be useful to have the list of files involved in the PR fixed at the left of the screen.\\
!1461527987-sample_review_pr.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Request: Suggestion on improving Pull Request UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Email notifications for pushed commits truncate commit messages at 100 characters. For commits whose messages are longer than that, the users will have to open the commit page to view the full commit message.

h3. Suggested Solution
Don't truncate the commit message in the email notifications, or set a bigger limit of characters.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see the full commit message in email notifications - Customer request

fields.description: Add a toolbar that only shows when you start scrolling a PR with the buttons merge, close, aprove, back to top, so that when reviewing large PRs you can simply take any actions there without having to scroll 50000 lines up to press the buttons. (maybe some other options would be cool, but those 3 are the buttons I feel lacking). Also the button "ignore white spaces" should be there too, since when you select in one file it will be applied to all anyway.
fields.summary: Add a toolbar for merge/close/aprove when scrolling a PR

fields.description: Sorting of files in the repository is captial first, then lower case. Can this be switched off so that 'c' sorts after 'B' instead of after 'Z'?
fields.summary: Bitbucket File Sort Order - Ignore Case

fields.description:
It will be great if the 1 MB limit for embedding images in on an issue can be increased.

Screen resolutions are getting very high and it's a bit of a hassle to compress an image every time a user need to emb an image file on an issue.

!1995665722-Screen%20Shot%202016-09-06%20at%2011.08.05%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Request: Increase Max file size > 1 MB for Embedding image files on an issue tracker ticket

fields.description:
We have a library that we compile with two profiles:

* with NDK for use when bundling with android
* with stock gcc, boost etc when bundling with a server app.

We would like to have two docker containers: one for the server build, one for the android build. We would like the pipeline to run a build with both the server profile and the android profile on a push.

Currently, when i try to add multiple steps to a pipeline, I get a "Currently, each pipeline can have only one step." error. This means that my options are to:

# merge the NDK dockerfile with the server build docker file.
# either build only in server mode or in android mode.
fields.summary: Multiple Steps Per Pipeline

fields.description:
Right now Pipelines clones a git repository to a depth of 50.

This cause an issue for us trying to push to another repo as part of our pipeline if our source and destination are too far out of sync which can happen for destinations that are not frequently updated.

Given the above it would be nice to be able to clone a repository with having a depth specified.
fields.summary: Support Configurable/Non-Shallow Git Clone Depth

fields.description:
Is it possible to add support for in branch permissions such that only branches that match a pattern can be created.

We are looking for a way to force users to create branches that begin with\\
feature/<jira-id>-free-text
fields.summary: Branch Permissions - Restrict branch names to match a pattern

fields.description:
In Bitbucket's _per-repository_ RSS feeds, individual commits are linked. However, in _per-user_ RSS feeds (e.g. {{https://bitbucket.org/dlenski/rss/feed?token=0DEADBEEF}}), the individual commits are unlinked — which is really, amazingly useless. The RSS feed appears to use a template like the following for each {{}} showing commits pushed: {code:xml} {{USER}} pushed {{NUM_COMMITS}} commit(s) to {{REPO}} https://bitbucket.org/{{OWNER}}/{{REPO}}/commits/all {{USER}} pushed {{NUM_COMMITS}} commit(s) to

  • {{COMMIT_HASH}} - {{COMMIT_MESSAGE_FIRST_LINE}}

 noreply@bitbucket.org ({{USER_FULL_NAME}}) {{COMMIT_DATE}} {code} This view would be far more useful if the individual commits were linked to the commit web-view, with this simple change to the template: {code:diff}
    -
  • {{COMMIT_HASH}} - {{COMMIT_MESSAGE_FIRST_LINE}}
    • +
  • {{COMMIT_HASH}} - {{COMMIT_MESSAGE_FIRST_LINE}}
{code} (It would also be useful if these "user pushed X commits" messages indicated the _branches_ to which the commits were pushed, but I suppose that's a separate issue.)
fields.summary: Link commits in per-user RSS feeds

fields.description:
When you search for a branch name when creating a new branch or a pull-request, if you type the exact branch you want, you still have to scroll past all of the other branches that contain that word. It would be nice if exact matches were floated up to the top.

For example, this happens with branches called: new_branch and branch_new
fields.summary: Prioritize exact matches in branch selection

fields.description:
When a user attempted to sync their fork with the upstream repo, but both the upstream and his fork contains two default branches, and the sync fails because of merge conflicts, but does not indicate the source or destination changeset.

The error dialog has a link to view the merge conflict, but picks the wrong default head (the other one, not the same commit used for sync) and the Compare screen shows an empty diff.
fields.summary: Repository Sync doesn't handle ambiguous hg/mercurial named branches (BBCDEV-2147)

With _Permission_ and _Integration_ in the Fork's Advanced settings selected and there's same repository name in the account, the settings will reset back to default after trigger _Fork Repository_ and _You already have a repository with this name_ error

fields.description:
BitBucket 4.8 introduced the ability to review at the commit level in a Pull Request, but those comments do not propagate to the Overview tab like commits on the final diff do.

An email is sent, but only the author of the PR will end up seeing that and the comment will almost certainly not be seen by anyone else.

It would be nice to see all of the comments on a PR on the overview tab.
fields.summary: PR Overview page should show comments made at the commit level

fields.description:
Hi,

For example I have a project with ID {{bucket}}. There are 2 repos belonged to that project: {{android}} and {{server}}.

Currently I have to name those repos with a prefix, obviously that prefix should be {{bucket}}. So I have 2 project URLs:

* {{https://bitbucket.org/username/bucket-android}} ({{-}} -> {{android}})
* {{https://bitbucket.org/username/bucket-server}} ({{-}} -> {{server}})

Would you please add option to use project IDs in repo URLs? For example I wish I could have these:

* {{https://bitbucket.org/username/bucket/android}} ({{/}} -> {{android}})
* {{https://bitbucket.org/username/bucket/server}} ({{/}} -> {{server}})

So I won't have to prefix my project IDs. It would help me a lot...

Thanks,
fields.summary: Option to include project ID in repo URLs

fields.description:
In order to create a new repository and be accessible to teams, you must now assign it to a project, whether it's to an existing project or to a new one. When you land on the "Create a new repository" screen, you are able to select or create a project as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/create-and-grant-access-to-team-repositories-665225545.html#Createandgrantaccesstoteamrepositories-Createarepositoryforyourteam], however this is actually quite difficult to accomplish if you have many projects:

If you want to add the repository to an existing project, you have to manually scroll through the list until you find it. Even then, the order of said list appears to be in chronological order, whereas if I know the specific name, then it would be more feasible to have the list ordered alphabetically. Better still, a search functionality would be great (much like when you select the language), so you can jump straight to it rather than attempting to scroll through the list manually.

If you want to create a new project, the button to do so can be found when you scroll down to the bottom of the list. However as the content is loaded in dynamically and then appended, this pushes the button further down, meaning that you have to scroll down again to reach it, but the same thing happens. Only until you reach the very end of the list, you are then able to click it. If you have a lot of projects, then this can take some time to reach. A viable solution to this would be to have the button at the top of the list instead, so there's no need to even scroll to reach it.

Finally, if you have accidentally clicked on a project name whilst searching, you have to start all the way back from the beginning of the list. Here, I would expect the list to jump to the position of the selection, but unfortunately it doesn't.

In all, this can be rather frustrating if you have many projects to work with.

tl;dr - selecting/creating a project when creating a repository and setting the owner to a team is annoying. :-)
fields.summary: Selecting/Creating Project when Creating New Repository

fields.description: If users have multiple repositories with the same name in the overview page, but users don't know which repository is from what Project and account, it can get real confusing.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Repositories listed on the right of the overview page (https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview) should list down the Projects they belong to as well.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to render the sub-section when there're only two sections in the Content.

###Steps to Reproduce

Use the following content:

{code}
#!python
Chapter 1 Title
=============

Section 1.1 Title
-----------------
{code}

!4043231776-reStructureTextBug.gif|thumbnail!

###Expected Results\\
Only show _"Chapter 1 Title"_

###Actual Results\\
Show both _"Chapter 1 Title"_ and _"Section 1.1 Title"_

###Workaround\\
Add another section into the content.\\
For instance:

{code}
#!python
Section 1.2 Title
-----------------

or 

Subsection 1.1.1 Title
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

or 

Chapter 2 Title
=============
{code}

!1284156999-reStructureTextBug2.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: reStructuredText: Unable to render the second section when there's only two section

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attempting to merge a PR sometimes closes the source branch without merging the PR.

Related to: BCLOUD-10242

The bug above occurs when there are conflicts in the PR.

However, we had a report where this occurred with a PR that had no conflicts -- the PR was not merged, but the source branch was closed.

"Close <source_branch> after the pull request is merged" option was checked in the PR.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Unable to reproduce
fields.summary: Merging a PR sometimes closes the source branch without merging the PR

fields.description:
There are times that more than 40 pull requests is ready for review. Each PR may have more than one reviewer. Given that fact that at these times developers and reviewers are under pressure, it's very hard to know whether you as a reviewer already done with a PR or not

I wish there was a facility, e.g. a button, for each reviewer that once he/she is done with a PR they can send the PR to a separate inbox, for example "Awaiting update" in a separate tab perhaps. The PR won't come back to "Ready for Review" tab/inbox of the reviewer unless the developer marked all the tasks created by that reviewer.

If the second reviewer hasn't finished his/her review yet, they can still see the same PR in their "Ready for Review" tab.

This way, I as a reviewer don't need to go to each PR only to find out that I have already reviewed this and I just need to wait for an update.

I understand that there is a hint popping up for each PR that tells you if there is open task for the PR or not but that includes other reviewer's tasks as well which is not useful. We may have different reviewers, reviewing different part of a PR.

This also makes the inbox clean and tidy
fields.summary: PRs Ready for review vs PRs waiting for update

fields.description:
I've found that pipelines doesn't kick off for the very first commit in a new repository. Doing a second commit works fine. While the workaround is pretty simple, it may be valuable to have working none-the-less.

As a new user to Pipelines, I try to get things to work with as simple a build as possible to discover how it works. A simple hello-world repository with bitbucket-pipelines.yml is enough to validate the feature. However, when I tried this out, it didn't kick off pipelines. Furthermore, it wasn't clear what I did wrong. As a new user to Pipelines, I ended up having to look up documentation, references, and be left scratching my head about what's wrong.
fields.summary: Pipelines doesn't run on first commit

This will allow users to compare the branches without navigating to *Repository Settings* to change the _Main Branch_.

fields.description:
I'm currently surveying Pipelines in order to see if our current Jenkins-based setup can be ported. It seems promising but I've searched for one key feature with no luck:

My setup is as follows: a "core" package is built from branch {{develop}} on changes. Build includes testing + deploy to Artifactory. Furthermore, I have a bunch of components (submodules.) These too are continuously built from branches {{develop}}. _Both "core" and components belong to the same team._

What I'm looking for is some way to manually trigger a Pipelines build for branches {{develop}} on all components when {{develop}} on "core" is successfully built and deployed. A workaround would be to push a change to a dummy file on each component but that seems a bit of a hack to me.

Is there anything I have missed in the documentation? What I would like is something like the following in "core":

{code}
#!yaml

pipelines: 
  branches: 
    develop: 
      - step: 
          script: 
            - ant -f build.xml my_ant_target_to_build_and_deploy
          downstream:
            - component1:develop
            - component2:develop
            - …
{code}
fields.summary: Trigger downstream builds

fields.description: In the OAuth integrated applications list the Last Accessed date is displayed in a very hard to read format.
fields.summary: OAuth settings page does not format last accessed date

fields.description:
There are times that we have many pull requests. We make comments and create tasks and then developers will update the PR later. When we come back to check the changes they made, we normally can't remember what changes we asked for exactly. This is a large scale application and with so many developers.

So if the file we commented against is changed, we no longer can see the comment or the task unless you go to 'Activity' tab which only shows you the outdated code. We need to have 2 window side by side one with outdated code and the other with the latest code after PR update.

I wish we could see a button or icon in front of each file that the reviewer made a comment and or created a task against it in the PR where the changed files are listed.

Then by just clicking on the button in front of the file, the reviewer could see both outdated one - that is currently can be seen in the activity - and the latest changes side-by-side.

The current side-by-side difference only shows the difference with the target branch to be merged in not with the previous commit

I can assume it is very hard to find what line of code we made comment against to display the task/comment as the newer commits may have radically changed the file but displaying the whole file including the comment/task we created for I believe is possible.
fields.summary: Suggestions for easier review

fields.description:
##Description

I wanted to discuss the issue when the pagelen parameter is greater than the maximum allowed for the api endpoint. Currently the behavior is that the endpoint returns a error with the message "invalid pagelen". I think the correct behavior here is that it should return the API call with the maximum pagelen allowed by that endpoint, especially since the pagelen is integrated in the response.

##Rationale

Having the API respond this way makes the endpoint very fragile. Meaning that you create a full break if there is even a small error in the request. This can raise overhead around coding exception cases to work around this. I think that generally the graceful failure route represents the better approach for a public API and allows for features built on top of it to be a lot more resilient.

##Repro

Valid: https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/jespern/django-piston/pullrequests?pagelen=50

Invalid:h ttps://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/jespern/django-piston/pullrequests?pagelen=51

##Related

This was mentioned in an earlier issue BCLOUD-9659, but the resolution proposed was the opposite (increasing max pagelen) and imho, correctly rejected.
fields.summary: BitBucket API fragile due to pagelen errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After creating a new project within Bitbucket cloud and adding a new repository to it, every repository notification settings are turned off by default.

h3. Environment
Bitbucket cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project
# Create a new repository on this project
# Check the repository notification settings

h3. Expected Results
All the notification settings should be turned on by default.

h3. Actual Results
The notification settings are turned off by default (see image).

!976575491-repo_notif_set.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
This only happens after creating a new project and a new repo. If you create new repo on an existing project the notification settings will be turned on by default.

h3. Workaround
Change the repo notification settings manually for the time being.
fields.summary: Repo notification settings turned off by default after creating a new project and a new repo.

I've replaced the result id but the rest is as-is from the URL so needless to say it doesn't work ;)

fields.description: Several users have reported that the email notifications are not working, despite watching the repositories etc.
fields.summary: Customers Report: Bitbucket users are not receiving email notifications.

fields.description:
Using *or* as the only joiner of filters can break basic searching or create completely useless results.

The issue is especially obvious when a binary attribute filter (only _is_ or _is not_) is negated. For each of these attributes (_priority_, _status_, etc.), their values are mutually exclusive thus, for searches like https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues?status=%21wontfix&status=%21duplicate, you're turning what should be {{(A ∩ B)'}} into {{A' ∩ B'}} which is the same as *no filter* at all. If _is not_ is chosen the joiner must be *and*.

For these binary filters, the _is_/_is not_ should only be selectable once per attribute, with additional filters on the same attribute forced to be identical to the first. Consider this example: searching for _status closed or status not wontfix_ yields identical results to searching only for _status not wontfix_. If you fix the lack of the *and* joiner, _status closed and status not wontfix_ would yield the same results as _status closed_.

For non-binary filters having *or* as the default joiner is counter-intuitive at best.
fields.summary: Faulty logic in Advanced search filters
